reviews.review_msg: Professor Munro is a great prof. Some of this course's material was super interesting and fun and some not so much. Enjoyed it for the most part, considering changing my major from psych to linguistics after this course. A good amount of info that he doesn't mention in lectures is provided in the textbook and will be on quizzes. Read it!

I loved this course with Dr. Munro. He's organized, smart, explains concepts well, nice, but rather callous. Exams are factual and tough. 330 IS A PHYSICS-HEAVY COURSE. Get ready for: acoustic principles, wave calculations, complex waves, harmonic analysis, source-filter theory, VOT measurement, Praat. Lowest A+ boundary in upper Ling for a reason.

Took this course thinking it would be interesting and mildly difficult as I needed the science requirement. I absolutely hate the course material and find it quite difficult for someone who has no linguistic background. Coming from a psychology background I don't mind anatomy but this is painfully bad. Had I known, I would've dropped out.

Munro was nice enough and the content was interesting, but the quizzes were difficult. Make sure to do the reading and pay attention to details as he puts trick questions on his quizzes. If you are looking for an easy elective, there are better options out there!

Murray is overall a sweet soul. He truly does care about his students, always ending off the lecture with a helping hand. If you want to do well in his class, SHOW UP. Most of the online quizzes are through his synchronous classes. My only problem. his quizzes have lots of questions with a VERY short time limit.

His lectures are so interesting and informative! I had low expectations for the course, but I ended up loving all the topics we covered. His quizzes and exams sometimes require a bit of thinking but are very fair. We were short on time with some quizzes, so he decided to mark some them by completion. Overall, one of the best profs I've had @ SFU

He is such a sweet prof that definitely cares about his subject and his students! Has one midterm, one final, and a group project. As long as you keep up with readings and lectures, the course is very doable. There are quizzes around every second week during the synchronous lecture, but they are very short, and pretty easy.

He is such an incredible teacher, and you can tell he really cares about the subject matter as well as his students. His lectures were informational but very entertaining, with lots of activities, discussions, and plenty of time for questions or comments. I'm not even a linguistics major and he's still by far the best professor I've ever had!

I thoroughly enjoyed having him has a prof! He is very passionate about what he teaches and you can tell he wants you to learn. He makes sure everyone is clear on everything and leaves lots of room for discussion and question. His tests can be a bit specific but as long as you red everything you should be fine! I hope to have another class with him
Best teacher in ling  he is quite tough but he wants u to learn.

I took this class as a science breadth, as I am an arts student, and I'd recommend it to anyone needing a sci-B! Three exams and one quiz; multiple choice and one-word short answers. The material was interesting to me, and I think Munro does a good job of teaching it! Sometimes he goes a little fast. The readings are quite tedious but used in tests
Really friendly prof who actually loves what he teaches and cares about students.
He does not upload his lecture notes on canvas. Notes on Canvas are here and there, so it is impossible to be on the same page with him. Exams are super tough.  I regret taking this course with him

He is good at explaining things and easy to understand.  But my only problem is that he expects us to read articles before we have gone over the info in class and be ready to be tested on it in the next exam.  Also, he doesn't post lecture slides.  As other reviews has said, the exams are very specific and it's dumb. -_-

Murray is an amazing guy. He's super interested in what he's teaching and that helps a LOT in lectures. He uses videos, recordings, and other materials to give students a better understanding of the topic and keep us interested. He also always makes time for questions. The exams are not EASY but if you have done the readings you will be okay. 3

He's a fantastic professor with clear explanations, but the course is essentially a more in-depth LING 100 with phonetics sprinkled in at the beginning. The exams ask ridiculously specific questions from the articles, but it's not too hard to get above an A-. Probably wouldn't recommend this professor over others in the department.

Dr. Munro is a really good prof and this is a fun class. Easy for those with prior Ling experience and the articles (in lieu of textbook) are really interesting. Everyone is bound to find one topic they enjoy in this class and Munro is engaging and great to learn from. Tests are easy if you do the readings and study the handouts.

He is definitely one of the more challenging profs in the Ling department. His lectures are very interesting, but his exams are VERY DIFFICULT! They require you to memorize insignificant detail in the textbook. If you are looking for a GPA booster, avoid his class.
i suck at his tests-however he's my fav prof cuz he knows how to make topics interesting. best SFU ling prof!
1 hr reading over workbook he posted and 3 hr practicing on exercises he posted before each midterm/the final, then i got A-. Textbook->useless

Very Good prof, no need to buy the textbooks, he'll post notes online, spend 1hr going over concept and then 3 hr practicing before each midter/the final, then you'll get at least B, i got A-, hope you can get higher and it's possible because i didn't spend much efforts for the final.

WORST prof ever! boriest lectures and make sure you bring ur pillow to your class, cus you'll fall asleep for sure. EXAMS WERE EXTREMELY HARD. Was sick for a midterm and didnt allow me to make up the midterm or move the weight to final exam even though I got an doctor's note. I guess its wrong to be sick like a dog and still have to crawl to class
Tough, but very good.  Explains concepts clearly and patiently.  You'd better do the homework though.  It may not be for marks, but if you don't do the practice, the tests will kick your ass.
He is a good prof. His tests are pretty easy if you do all the assignments. His lecture is funny especially his example showing what is ungrammatical.
interesting lecture. he's organized, and has a sense of humour. test is fair as long as u practice. juz do all the ques he gives u and u'll b more than fine.

Dr. Munro is a very good lecturer - he even makes stats clear and not boring! His tests were ok, but you can learn so much from him without huge amounts of effort. Totally take him if you have the chance!!
make sure you fully understand his material not only memorize them all! he's a great prof and he knows what he's teaching and he seems very interested in his job!
Very well organized person and the material he taught was very useful. Great prof!
excellent. Very clear and helpful
exams are very hard..! totally different from what he's teaching in class..!
Very organized & able to communicate material clearly. Excellent prof.
No Comments
class notes are totally different from the exams.  avoid courses he's teaching.
quizzes and exams are very hard.  totally different from lectures.
Good, but tough!!
